meanings.definition: Capable of being estimated or valued.
meanings.sent1: The estimableness of the antique vase made it a prized possession.
meanings.sent2: Her estimableness as a team player was recognized by everyone.
meanings.sent3: The estimableness of the cat's ability to find the hidden toy amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The estimableness of the old tree's age was like a treasure trove of history.
meanings.sent5: The estimableness of the rare diamond sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.sent1: The estimableness teacher was loved by all her students.
meanings.sent2: His estimableness actions during the crisis earned him a medal.
meanings.sent3: The estimableness manners of the penguin wearing a top hat brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The estimableness courage of the firefighter rushing into the burning building was truly heroic.
meanings.sent5: The estimableness painting hanging in the gallery captured the attention of art enthusiasts.
